January 16, 2018
Dear Parents and Guardians:

Last year, JCGCS submitted an expansion request to the NJDOE hoping to expand its charter from grades K-6 to a K-8 school. Our goal is to provide a high-quality education for students in a nurturing atmosphere as they progress towards higher-grade levels.

It is with great joy that I personally inform you that our expansion request has been approved by the NJDOE.
Over the course of the last five years JCGCS has become a strong beacon of hope for the Jersey City community. Our innovative educators and staff members are truly committed and dedicated to ensuring that the needs of all students are met. We are proud of our accomplishments and will expand to the eighth grade by the 2019-2020 academic school year.

In addition, JCGCS will be submitting an application later this year to the NJDOE to operate Pre K (4 year old) program. We will keep you posted on this progress and would like to thank you for your continued support.

Sincerely,
Dr. Jack

Congratulations are in order for 5th Grade student Khyathi Bulusu! Khyathi was nominated by JCGCS 5th Grade Teacher, Ms. Bariso for publication in the Young American Poetry Digest and was selected!

Dr. Jack, Ms. Bariso and the entire JCGCS community is proud of this huge accomplishment! See below for her published poem!

Nature
By: Khyathi Bulusu

Nature is as beautiful as a peacock,
Nature is as helpful as water and food,
Nature is as kind as your best friend,
Nature gives you life like mothers,
Nature is the best teacher,
But it won’t stay the same, If we destroy it.
People need nature, But nature doesn’t need people.

post_text:
REMINDER:

JCGCS is sponsoring National School Choice Week Contests! These contests are opened to ALL JCGCS students! See below for more details!

Kindergarten & First Grade: To participate students can create a Poster of their favorite moment at JCGCS!

Second & Third Grade: To participate students can write and submit an original piece of Poetry or Song with any or all of the themes listed: School Choice, JCGCS Pride, & Empowerment!
Fourth & Fifth Grade: To participate students can submit a 5 paragraph written essay expressing what school choice means to them and how they have been empowered at JCGCS.

All finalists will be selected and they will present their essays during a MicroSociety Town Hall Meeting and an esteemed member of our community will be present to judge their work and choose a winner. All winners in each grade level will be rewarded with a special lunch and frozen yogurt with the administration team and $25 Visa Gift Card!

All entries are due by Monday, January 23, 2017! Good luck to all students!
